title: 2 people, dog attacked by moose near Nederland
summary:
BOULDER COUNTY, Colo. (KDVR) — Colorado Parks and Wildlife says a man, woman and dog were injured after being charged by a moose near the West Magnolia Trailhead near Nederland on Wednesday morning.
The deputy tried to scare off the moose by firing bean bags rounds at it.
Then, while the deputy was helping the two injured people, the moose returned.
The deputy fired a warning shot and the moose left the area a second time.
CPW said both of those incidents were from cows that exhibited defensive behavior near their calves.
